page.title: 10St Rumwold
page.content: { St Rumwold}was born in 630 and his grandfather was {Penda,} last of the heathen warrior king of Mercia. Legend says that at the age of{three days,}he sat up and {asked }to be Baptized and buried in Buckingham. This is most unlikely because people took ages from when they was first christened, not from when he was born. He was probably a{young man}when this happened and he died three days later. His wishes were carried out because he was considered a saint. Several {churches, wells}and{springs}have been dedicated}to him. Pilgrims used to flock to Buckingham to drink at his well and pray at his shrine. In old{Buckingham, }there is a Street named after him, where he is supposed to have spoken his wishes.
